alert.note: Alert for Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 11:18AM MDT until June 11 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Mesa County along Plateau Creek, from the outlet of Vega Reservoir down to the confluence with the Colorado River. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Elevated stream flows will continue to cause minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1113 AM MDT, public reports and gage data have indicated high water along Plateau Creek near Collbran, downstream to the confluence with the Colorado River. Forecast hydrographs maintain high water levels, oscillating near bankfull conditions through the weekend. Minor flooding along creek banks has been reported and is expected to redevelop each night, when diurnal fluctuations typically maximize. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Collbran and Molina. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads, bike paths or sidewalks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In addition, this is typically when diurnal peaks are observed along Plateau Creek.
